title: Home and Away's Joel McIlroy charged with punching and shoulder-charging a police woman

Home and Away star Joel McIlroy spent the night behind bars after allegedly punching and shoulder-charging a female police officer in Sydney's Surrey Hills in Australia on Tuesday.

The former actor, 46, then appeared in court on Wednesday and was refused bail by the magistrate.

The soap star allegedly punched a senior female constable several times and shoulder-charged her during the arrest of another man and could now face up to two-weeks in jail.

Joel was represented by a Legal Aid lawyer, who told the court that the actor was diagnosed with Huntington's disease, ten years ago, The Daily Telegraph reported.

His legal representative said the disease meant he was not always able to "control his impulses".

Police allege that around 11:15am on Tuesday morning another man was under arrest for a minor property-related offences.

Joel then approached the scene and was asked to leave by the police as he was not involved in the incident, police claim.

(Image: Getty Images)

The actor then allegedly shoulder-charged and punched the female constable.

Police attempted to arrest him before a scuffle broke out, which led to the star and two officers falling to the floor.

McIlroy was then arrested and taken to the local Police Station in Surrey Hills.

(Image: 9 News)

(Image: 9 News)

McIlroy was charged with two counts of assaulting an officer while on duty, resisting an officer on duty and wilfully obstructing an officer while on duty.

He is scheduled to next appear in court on November 5.

Joel is best known for his role of Flynn Saunders in Australian soap opera Home and Away.

He first took over the role in 2003 - after actor Martin Dingle-Wall left the show.
